feedback.Physical object: Included — A mounted, enclosed sensing unit occupying physical space.
feedback.Biological or biologically-inspired: Excluded — Detection based on photoelectric or ionization physics, not biology.
feedback.Fixed/static: Included — Installed on ceilings or walls for permanent operation.
feedback.Structural: Included — Internal chamber and layout affect sensing performance.
feedback.Perceptible: Included — Alarms are loud and visible, with obvious device presence.
feedback.Material form: Included — Plastic housing and embedded electronics.
feedback.Passive: Excluded — Continuously monitors and emits alerts; not inert.
feedback.Purposeful / intentional: Included — Built for the specific task of smoke detection and alert.
feedback.Emits output / produces effect: Included — Produces audible (and often visual) alarm signals.
feedback.Processes or regulates logic/signals: Included — Uses logic to detect smoke density and decide threshold events.
feedback.Transforms or modifies internal state: Included — Tracks alarm states, test results, or battery conditions.
feedback.Interacts with humans directly: Excluded — Has minimal interaction beyond alarm sound and test button.
feedback.Part of a larger system: Included — May be networked with other detectors or security systems.
feedback.Autonomous in function: Included — Operates continuously without manual input.
feedback.System-critical: Included — Essential for life safety in many regulated spaces.
feedback.Symbolic / representational: Excluded — Operates functionally, not as a symbol.
feedback.Communicative: Excluded — Communicates alerts but not through symbolic content.
feedback.Logical / rule-based: Included — Triggers alarm only when predefined thresholds are exceeded.
feedback.Hierarchical / modular: Excluded — Usually not semantically modular, though hardware may be.
feedback.Behavior-guiding: Excluded — May prompt action but does not prescribe behavior.
feedback.Self-referential / meta-conceptual: Excluded — No reflective logic or awareness of self.
feedback.Temporal: Included — Constant time-based sensing, with potential logging features.
feedback.Contextual abstraction: Excluded — Operates independently of symbolic or social context.
feedback.Socially / culturally constructed: Excluded — Function defined by physics, not social meaning.
feedback.Defined by a group/system: Excluded — While manufactured to spec, not semantically group-defined.
feedback.Regulated / governed: Included — Subject to strict building codes and fire safety standards.
feedback.Teachable / transmissible: Excluded — Can be explained, but not designed for didactic use.
feedback.Visible: Included — Visibly present and designed for easy recognition.
feedback.Context-sensitive: Excluded — Operates the same across environments.
feedback.Widely known: Included — Universally recognized life safety device.

encoding_notes: This encoding reflects a smoke detector as a structurally fixed, perceptible, and autonomous safety device. It is defined by logical sensing and regulatory inclusion. Though not user-interactive or symbolic, its system-critical function and legal mandate justify inclusion of autonomy and governance traits.
